content.description:
Fun climbing up nice rock with a variety of pro options and a smattering of bolts.

Descend the standard 3rd class git off to the climber's right.
content.protection: Mix of bolts and small to medium gear.
content.location:
Located on the far right side of Crystal Wall.

Around 20 feet left of Rehearsal and just left of another newer 5.5 route.

content.description:
One of the newer "unknown" routes and a worthy venue.

Engaging slab climbing protected with bolts, a smattering of pro, a few more bolts...good stuff.

Solid rock and nice moves.
content.protection: 3 bolts, gear, couple more bolts, more gear.  Standard rock with smallish cams.
content.location:
Located just left of the black streaks of Ask Mr. Lizard (5.10).

Right of the left-leaning crack start of Placebo.

content.description: Bolted line at the low point along the crag.
content.location: Leftmost of 3 short bolted lines. The other 2 are 5.11 and 5.12 respectively.

content.description:
Climb up, into, through and past the circular hole pockets (left one is cam-able).

Continue up past 3 bolts on slab-a-luscious rock.  Some pro opportunities and knobby climbing lead to a bolted anchor.

Another easier pitch leads to the summit.

Descend off the back side of the ridge.

Fun climbing on great rock in a great location!
content.protection: A few quickdraws, shoulder length slings, and a smattering of small to medium sized cams.
content.location:
Middle-ish at the Crystal Wall.  Route is located at two circular holes (left one softball size, the right one basketball size).

Just left of He's Got Marty Feldman Eyes.

climbs.name: Magic Carpet Ride
climbs.fa: Chuck Fitch, Steve Fitch and Brian Smith

content.description:
This route climbs a right facing dihedral with an obvious chimney halfway up the first pitch.  It has some interesting moves on the first pitch and the second pitch is mostly an easy scramble.

Pitch 1:  Climb up the dihedral (stay in it) into the chimney and exit to the right.  Follow the dihedral until it ends and then climb up a short section of face to a large ledge (5.9).

Pitch 2:  Follow easy climbing up and into a right facing corner on the right of a large outcrop (5.6).
content.protection: A set of nuts and single cams to 4"
content.location: Walk towards the far end of Crystal Wall and before it rounds off look for the right facing corner with some moss and an obvious chimney.

climbs.name: He's Got Marty Feldman Eyes
climbs.fa: E.C. Joe, Veronica Hawke and Vaughn Schultz, July '89

content.description:
The is a fun face/slab route that eases up the higher you go.

Pitch 1:  Follow about six bolts a full rope length up to a two bolt belay.  The crux down low is protected well with three bolts but they're more spaced out above and can be supplemented with a few .5-2" pieces.  5.10-

Pitch 2:  Rap with two ropes or climb up to the right of a groove past a couple old bolts until you feel comfortable walking off.  5.5
content.protection: Half a dozen draws and a few small to medium cams.
content.location: From the approach, walk a short ways along the base past an 8' left arching crack.  The bolted route left of this crack is the start.  If you get to two softball sized pockets 6' off the ground you're one route too far.

content.description: Climb the bolt line just right of Crystal past 5 bolts to a 2 bolt belay. Continue up from there to the right of Crystal to join it at the ledge for another pitch.
Go up the prominent bulge in the center of the wall to the right of the small pillar. 2 short bolted pitches or one long one to a ledge. Continue up the right side of the ledge with gear to the top.
Climb the face to good knobs. 7 Bolts/small stoppers.
content.location: Climb starts 6' downhill from first oak.
